New Records: Nick Martinez achieved a 3-0 record with a 0.48 ERA in September, including a strong performance against the Twins.
The Cincinnati Reds scored nine runs in the fourth inning, setting a new team record for the highest run total in an inning during the game.
Key Match Events: The Reds scored nine runs in the fourth inning, turning the game significantly in their favor.
Nick Martinez pitched six strong innings, allowing only one run and three hits with six strikeouts, a standout performance.
Pre-Game Insights: The Twins were struggling in their last 11 games, with fewer than three runs in six of those games, indicating a potential slump.
The Reds' performance was noted as a strong showing against a team with a strong lineup.
Post-Match Reflections: Minnesota Twins manager Rocco Baldelli emphasized the need for the team to play with urgency and relaxation, reflecting on their recent struggles.
Carlos Correa returned from plantar fasciitis and played four innings, doubling in his second plate appearance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins were 2.5 games ahead of Detroit for the AL playoff berth but dropped 3.5 games behind Kansas City for the wild card.
Brent Suter pitched three scoreless innings to earn his second save of the season.
Others: Hunter Greene was slated to throw live batting practice, potentially returning for two more starts this season.
The Twins' struggles were noted as a team issue, with players expressing frustration and the need to refocus.
